title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submit application online via the college's university employment page, include references, resume, and cover letter. Once screened, the next step if chosen is setting up a phone call with the search committee. If chosen to move to the next step, you're invited to an on-campus interview.

title: Academic Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME)
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to interview within a few days of submitting my application. The interview was conducted by a panel of 5 people, including professors. Everyone was very professional and courteous throughout the interview process, though the questions seemed more free form and off the cuff.    In a sense, the questions were vague and didn’t really offer an opportunity to demonstrate that I (or the candidate) had the skills necessary for the position.
Interview Questions: You have been asked to scan an entire shelf of files by Friday. How would your respond in this situation?

title: IT Help Desk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal. The student-run interview asked me basic questions about my employment history as well as some other standard student job questions. They ended by asking me my favorite flavor of ice cream. Very nice interviewers and an easy interview.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite flavor of ice cream?

title: Admissions Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Written letter of purpose, recommendations, and in-person interview. Networking and understanding the Bates admissions process is crucial toward a successful interview process. Following the in-person interview the interviewee is contacted by a Dean of Admission.
Interview Questions: What does Bates mean to you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Committee style interview. Very comfortable setting and overall calm and comfortable process.   Open ended questions, open for me to ask questions. Very knowledgeable panel. Representatives from each relevant department present.
Interview Questions: Why I thought I was the best for the job

title: Student Concierge Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME)
Interview Descriptions: interview didn't take very long. Interviewer was interested in my interpersonal skills, ability to talk well on the phone etc. The interview process was pretty simple.
Interview Questions: They were all very simple questions, really.

title: Assistant Dean of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing is conducted over a full work day, wherein candidates meet with representatives from admissions, student services, and affirmative action. Bates in most cases may take care of travel accommodations if their coming in from out of state.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: Received an email over the summer inviting me to be a TA. There was no interview. I accepted the position.
Interview Questions: There was no interview so no difficult questions.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brief practical interview with the student manager. Asked questions about my past jobs and how they would help in this role, my personal life (extracurriculars), future goals and how it related to tech, and questions about how I would solve certain computer issues. Also asked how I would solve problems I had never encountered.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a computer screen was black, but the computer was on?

title: Bass Singer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions:
During a specific date range, I picked the audition time that suited me best. I was told to prepare a chorus and a verse of my favorite song - at the time it was Do I Wanna Know by the Arctic Monkeys. I entered the audition room where all the member of the Crosstones were sitting, ready to assess me. The musical director gave me various musical tasks so as to know my vocal range and my listening ability. I then sang my solo without background accompaniment. 

For the callback audition, I was given sheet music for Coldplay's Fix You. I studied the bass part with a bass singer from the Crosstones and other auditioners. For the audition itself, I sang my part with the rest of the group twice. I left the room, and that evening I received a phone call congratulating me.

title: Chef Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Bates College
Interview Descriptions: Know your stuff. Sauces, spices, etc. If you don't you might as well be an entry cook
Interview Questions: I was given a written test

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME)
Interview Descriptions: Long wait for interview, one interview and then a long wait for offer

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Bates College (Lewiston, ME)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for about 5 minutes and offered a job.  This was before the use of hiring committees.
